overview:
Mark currently serves as President and CEO of SteelHouse, a digital display advertising platform for eCommerce marketers.

Mark started his career as part of the founding team of Oracle Applications Division in Silicon Valley, now a multi-billion dollar business. He went on to found CenterView Software and served as President & CEO until its acquisition by Informix Software. He then served as CTO at Persistence Software, which received an IPO. He also worked as VP Technology at Covalent Technologies, which was funded by Sequoia Capital and Menlo Ventures and later acquired by VMWare as part of its acquisition of SpringSource. After this, Mark moved to Los Angeles, where he served as VP Technology at eHarmony for nearly four years building their technology infrastructure while company grew to be one of the most recognized brands in America. Most recently, Mark served as VP Engineering at the Rubicon project, where he built upon his real world experience in the digital advertising industry.
